tweets.text:
Alright, @vgr's 100-onion challenge accepted.

1 like = 1 onion 

Capping this at 100 onions. I'll try my best. Let's go!  

(a thread) https://t.co/fJBoUQVzMz
@vgr 1. Here's a 17 lb. 15 oz. onion grown by a 67-year-old retired chartered surveyor. https://t.co/8JDuVvlI1I
@vgr 2. This onion started as three onions. https://t.co/fvAD5aIFjG
@vgr 3. Someone made this anthropomorphic onion. [Stock photo] https://t.co/9V1oV9f65v
4. This is a cipollini onion, which is slightly less sweet than a shallot. https://t.co/M0JmGFNxYB
5. This is an example photo for giant red onion seeds you can buy on Amazon. https://t.co/a6A8OgNHXg

6. This is the ambassador of Vidalia, Georgia, called "Yumion the Onion". 
@vidaliaonionsGA https://t.co/8QWF5xt67g
@vidaliaonionsGA 7. This is a nice way to present a red onion to your dinner guests. https://t.co/5TBq2E8ILu
@vidaliaonionsGA 8. These onions were cut by a chef wearing onion goggles, to prevent themselves from crying.í ½í¸­ https://t.co/joFknhWSql
@vidaliaonionsGA 9. This is a pile of cull onions that many beef cattle enjoy eating, in moderation. https://t.co/axgsSEjL5l
@vidaliaonionsGA 10. This fossilized onion bulb is 1500 years old. https://t.co/xEdCzJi0xZ
@vidaliaonionsGA 11. This is a petrified onion you can buy on eBay for $225. https://t.co/jBJ0z35Uee
12. This is an industrial machine for making onion rings. https://t.co/6y2llsRFqY
13. An optical onion sorter for automated quality control. https://t.co/WvKLMmQ684
14. There is an Egyptian festival called "Bastet", where onions are chewed as part of a ritual to ward off snakes. https://t.co/XpHmYzmxSO
15. This is onion soup made from an 1804 recipe, cooked in an outdoor stove. https://t.co/acjpWsdMdE https://t.co/xh4xL2BN96
16. An onion peeling machine. I'm also curious how many humans are peeling onions at this very moment. https://t.co/GeFQV5Yfnr
17. The Tor Browser is onion-themed, because TOR actually stands for "The Onion Router". Layers of an onion = layers of encryption. https://t.co/Ci6lJRA0Uc
18. Pearl onions are usually the one kind of onion you can find in the frozen foods section. https://t.co/xpyBMAU3Pq
(And you guys, I have to be somewhere! Didn't expect this thread to get more than 3 likes. I'll be back later with more onions.)
19. A Grelot onion is named after a small round bell you can put on a cat. Itâ€™s okay to eat the stalk. https://t.co/y0d71gbDmz
20. This is an onion-shaped case meant to store an onion. Nobody needs one of these. https://t.co/nuQDdJcaR6
21. When I was 21, I was an p/t unpaid intern for The Onion in their New York office. I hoped to work on content, but my job was to reformat images and I quit after one day. https://t.co/PPLj7mkAG8
22. I do still appreciate The Onion. I used to enjoy reading paper copies you could find in these kiosks in Chicago in the early 2000s. https://t.co/7hBL2zWETH
23. Here's an onion that's ready to answer any of your questions. https://t.co/cbNO4iY0rJ
24. Here's a giant plushie onion on AliExpress. You can get a whole set of plush veggies that would be good in a soup. https://t.co/vtR2BXS4Z1
25. There's no onion emoji! Instead you have to do the "crying potato" í ¾íµ”í ½í¸¢ to express onion.
26. This is the Onion King from Overcooked. https://t.co/htORAMrjZa
27. All onions are mine and do not reflect my employer.
28. Here's a vidalia onion field from yesterday. í ½í³¸ by @searchbound, who is the proprietor of https://t.co/i8UuE3pfJb. If you have onion inquiries, ask Peter! https://t.co/mwlXVG2syR
